boat.name: Royal Oak
boat.full_description: Royal Oak is one of the last BRA 12 boats of the Dreadnought fleet designed  for West Kirby Sailing Club in 1913 by George Cockshott of Southport  Corinthian Yacht Club. The originals were built by Roberts of Chester,  but Royal Oak was built in 1937 by Bonds of Rockferry. The class was  used by the Royal Navy for training exported worldwide, and was adopted by  the Dutch and Italians after the 1924 and 1928.olympics
boat.construction_details: Royal Oak built by Bond’s in 1937, one of the Dreadnought fleet built for West Kirby Sailing Club in 1913, originals built by Roberts of Chester. Designed by George Cockshott of Southport Corinthian Yacht Club. Last remaining boat of the fleet.
boat.short_description: Royal Oak, built by Bond’s in 1937, is the last remaining boat of the Dreadnought fleet built for West Kirby Sailing Club.
